content:
Matt laughed. "You know you want to, Jack. It's going to be a blast."

Jack hesitated for a moment, his mind already calculating how he could make it to the museum after the party. But then he remembered his mother's words, and the concern in her eyes when she had seen how obsessed he had become.

"Actually, I think I'll pass," he said, surprising both Matt and himself. "I've got some other stuff I need to take care of."

Matt shrugged. "Suit yourself. But I think you're missing out."

Jack watched as his friend walked away, and then turned and made his way to the library. He had work to do, and a plan to make. He had to find a way to see the mirror again, no matter what. And this time, he wouldn't let anything stand in his way.
